content: Hello! I'd like to see the current queue, please. Can you show me who's currently on it?
intent: user wants to view the current queue

Hello! I was wondering if you could help me understand how your queueing system works. I'm not too familiar with it and would like to know how I can add myself to the queue and what other options are available. Thanks!

Hello! I'd be happy to help you understand how the queueing system works. You can add yourself to the end of the queue simply by requesting to be added. If you need to leave the queue, you can also pop yourself off. Additionally, you can ask to list all the customers currently in the queue to see the order or check who is next. If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask!

Thank you for explaining that! It sounds pretty straightforward. Just to clarify, if I add myself to the queue, will I receive any notification when it's my turn, or do I need to keep checking the list to see where I am?

In this queueing system, you typically need to keep checking the list to see where you are, as notifications aren't automatically sent when it's your turn. This way, you can monitor your position in the queue and have an idea of when you'll be next. If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!

Hello! I have a question about your queueing system. Can you help me understand how it works?

Hello! I'd be happy to help you understand our queueing system. Our system helps customers add themselves to the end of the queue, remove themselves from the queue, and view the current list of customers in the queue. This is particularly useful for managing reservations at a restaurant. If you have any specific questions about how to use it, feel free to ask!
Thanks for the explanation! I was wondering, is there a limit to how many people can be in the queue at one time?

Currently, there's no specific limit to how many people can be in the queue at one time. The system is designed to handle a flexible number of customers to accommodate varying demand, especially during peak times. If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!

Hello! I hope you're having a great day. I have a question about your queueing system. Could you help me understand how it works and what I can do with it?

Hello! I'm here to help you understand the queueing system. With this system, you can:  1. **Add yourself to the queue** - This puts you at the end of the line, waiting for your turn. 2. **Remove yourself from the queue** - If you no longer need to be in the queue, you can pop yourself off. 3. **View the queue** - See the list of all customers currently in line, so you know who's next.  Feel free to ask if you need more specific information about how to use any of these features!
Thanks for explaining that! I think I understand the basics now. Could you tell me if there's a limit to how many people can be in the queue at one time?

There isn't a specific limit to how many people can be in the queue at one time; it typically depends on the system's capacity and the restaurant's policies. If you have any other questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask!
Got it, thanks for the info! I'm curious, is there a way to estimate how long the wait might be once I'm in the queue?

The wait time can depend on several factors, such as the number of people ahead of you, the average time each party spends at a table, and the restaurant's efficiency. Unfortunately, without specific data on these factors, it's difficult to provide an accurate estimate. However, some restaurants might give you an approximate wait time when you join the queue.
